  • Uses of CryptoException in i5.las2peer.tools

    Methods in i5.las2peer.tools that throw CryptoException 
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static java.io.Serializable CryptoTools.decryptAsymmetric​(byte[] data, java.security.PrivateKey key)
    decrypt the given content with the given private key and try to deserialize the resulting byte array
    static byte[] CryptoTools.decryptSymmetric​(byte[] baCipherData, javax.crypto.SecretKey key)
    decrypt a symmetrically encrypted byte block using the given key
    static java.io.Serializable CryptoTools.depryptPassphaseObject​(byte[] content, byte[] salt, java.lang.String passphrase)
    descrypt (and deserialize) the given encrypted data using the given passphrase and salt
    static byte[] CryptoTools.encryptAsymmetric​(byte[] content, java.security.PublicKey key)
    encrypt the given data asymmetrically using the given public key
    static byte[] CryptoTools.encryptAsymmetric​(java.io.Serializable content, java.security.PublicKey key)
    encrypt the given data after serialization using the given public key
    static byte[] CryptoTools.encryptSymmetric​(byte[] baPlainData, javax.crypto.SecretKey symmetricKey)
    encrypt the given data symmetrically with the given key
    static byte[] CryptoTools.encryptSymmetric​(java.io.Serializable plainData, javax.crypto.SecretKey key)
    encrypt the given object after serialization with the givne key
    static byte[] CryptoTools.encryptWithPassphrase​(java.io.Serializable object, java.lang.String passphrase, byte[] salt)
    encrypt a serializable object using the given passphrase an salt make sure to use real random salts e.g. via the CryptoTools.generateSalt() method
    static javax.crypto.SecretKey CryptoTools.generateKeyForPassphrase​(java.lang.String passphrase, byte[] salt)
    generate a symmetric key for the given passphrase using the given salt make sure to use real random salts e.g.
    static byte[] CryptoTools.generateSalt()
    generate a random salt
    NodeInformation L2pNodeLauncher.getLocalNodeInfo()
    get the information stored about the local Node
